name: Closure phase - BT Replay
description:
| Phase | Step | Outcome |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| Closure Blue Team  | 2 of 3 | Red Team and Blue Team Replay |

# Tasks

- `Task #1 - Repeat those undetected steps by the blue team`
- `Task #2 - Check visibility`
- `Task #3 - Develop detection`
- `Task #3 - Implement Detections`

# Replay

After the RT provider and BT deliver their reports, the entity must arrange a replay workshop. The goal of this workshop is to learn from the testing experience in collaboration with the RT provider. During the workshop, a replay is organised in which the BT and the RT provider review the steps taken by both parties during the test.

Additionally, a purple teaming element can be added, in which the BT and the RT provider work together to see which other steps could have been taken by the RT provider and how the BT could have responded to those steps.

tasks.title: Task #1 - Repeat those undetected steps by the blue team
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on `Closure Blue Team #1 - Report`, specifically the outcome on unidentified steps.

# Goal

Your goal is to repeat all those steps that **the blue team was not able to detect when the tests were launched without their knowledge.**

Each time a step is executed, the blue team must be notified before and after the step. This will help the blue team to be aware and have a range of time to look for evidence of the step taken.

tasks.title: Task #3 - Develop detection
tasks.group: Blue Team and Detection Engineer Team
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on the `Task #2 - Check visibility` and those steps that you were able to identify some evidence.

# Goal

Now that you know that there is visibility into the step executed by the red team, it is time to develop some detection to be able to detect it next time. 

**Research and develop different ways** to detect the red team pass. Identify possible false positives and re-run the step yourself if possible.

**It is very important to develop the least noisy detection rule possible.**

We recommend using [SIGMA](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma) to create detection rules, as in many cases, these can be converted to your `Entity` technology through services such as https://uncoder.io or Sigmac tool https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/tools/README.md.

tasks.title: Task #2 - Check visibility
tasks.group: Blue Team and Detection Engineer Team
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on every step repeated by the red team. You've to repeat the actions of this task for each repeated step.

Also, the table of the `Case Closure Blue Team #1 - Report` and `Task #3 - ` is needed here.

# Goal

The red team has notified you that a step was executed again. Now it is time to use the table with the possible data sources that could help you to have visibility on the step executed by the red team and create some kind of detection in your environment.

If you managed to see the step, go to the next `task (#3)` of this case.

If you did not manage to see the step taken by the red team, investigate how new technologies or ways of detecting such a step could be implemented in the infrastructure. Discuss this point with the Detection Engineers of the `Entity`.

tasks.title: Task #4 - Implement Detections
tasks.group: Blue Team and Detection Engineer Team
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on `Task #3 - Develop detection`.

# Goal

Once the new detection rules have been developed, it is time to implement them. Maybe in your `Entity` it is not the Blue team that is responsible for this task and it is a Detection Engineer Team. In either case, the developed detections must be implemented.

Although TIBER-EU does not say to re-launch the red team steps again, it is advisable to re-launch the red team steps once the detections have been implemented and check that there really are alerts notifying us of the actions performed.
